mil.emp3.api.events

Class UserInteractionEvent<TargetType extends IContainer>

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.emp3.api.events.Event<UserInteractionEventEnum,TargetType>
      • mil.emp3.api.events.UserInteractionEvent<TargetType>
  • Type Parameters:
    TargetType - A java type derived from IContainer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEvent<UserInteractionEventEnum,TargetType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapUserInteractionEvent

    public abstract class UserInteractionEvent<TargetType extends IContainer>
extends Event<UserInteractionEventEnum,TargetType>
    This event is the base class for the FeatureUserInteractionEvent and the MapUserInteractionEvent.

    • Method Detail

      • getPoint

        public android.graphics.Point getPoint()
        This method returns the x,y coordinate of the location the event occurred at. Where 0,0 is the origin of the map container. The value of the object is only valid for the duration of the event callback. The event handler MUST NOT keep a reference to the object.
        Returns:

      • getCoordinate

        public org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoPosition getCoordinate()
        This method return the geographic coordinates of the location where the event occurred at. The value of the object is only valid for the duration of the event callback. The event handler MUST NOT keep a reference to the object.
        Returns:
        An object that implements the IGeoPosition interface, or null if the event occurred off the map.

      • getStartCoordinate

        public org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoPosition getStartCoordinate()
        This method returns the start coordinate. It is only valid for DRAG event. The value of the object is only valid for the duration of the event callback. The event handler MUST NOT keep a reference to the object.
        Returns:

      • getButton

        public UserInteractionMouseButtonEnum getButton()
        This method returns the mouse button if pressed. Values are left, right, middle or none.
        Returns:

      • getKeys

        public java.util.EnumSet<UserInteractionKeyEnum> getKeys()
        This method returns any keys if pressed Values are Shift, Ctrl and Alt
        Returns:
